title: Software Upgrades of Beam and Irradiation Test Infrastructures in AIDA-2020

author: Blerina Gkotse, CERN - European Organization for Nuclear Research

segmentation: So hello everybody, I am learning my godson today.
I'm going to present you either 2020 which is a bit not totally related to the web semantics except from my work let's say.
But first I will start.
By describing what is high the 2020 so actually is a European funded project which is about the advanced European infrastructures for detectors at accelerators.
I'm.
So a this?
So in either 2020 there are 24 countries and CERN, the European Organization of particle physics.
It is actually a coordinated program in line with the priorities of the European Strategy for particle physics.
There are several activities like networking activities, transnational access and joint research activities, and there is also.
Annuus letters the newsletter that you can check online.
So in either 2020 there are 15 more packages.

They're theoretically independent, but they are meant to kind of foster synergies among this war packages an my work is related to the work package 15, which is about the upgrade of beam and irradiation test infrastructures.
But let's see first.
What are these infrastructures?

So these test facilities are used for the qualification of particle detectors, material and components prior their installation in high energy physics experiments such as those performed at CERN and the work package 15 is about the improvement of these infrastructures.
So some projects that I was involved in this work package was first the data collection and the development of an online open open platform where people they can find data about.
This infrastructures around the world.
Currently we have 211 institutes that people they can go and search for it, which was quite important.
In this way people they can look where they can perform their experiments.

And another another project that I am involved is about the proton irradiation facility which is at CERN and it's actually one of these infrastructures which performs tests with a proton beam of 24 GV.
Oversee an is also testing detectors about high energy physics experiments.
I'm so just to give an idea only for 2018 we had around 81 experiments and 92 users and 792 objects that we had to test and we had.
So this means that we had a lot of data to collect and analyze about the experiments about the users and their results.

For this reason, one of the other projects that we did with in either 2020 was a web application about the data management of these experiments, but this was basically more applied to our infrastructure there here at facility.
So.

By the knowledge gained by this development, but also by the survey of the previous infrastructures that we provided online, we build any radiation experiment experiments, data management, ontology that was also presented yesterday in the poster, and in this way we want to model the key entities of the experiments workflow than later could.
Sorry could be used for other facilities since we have realized that they don't really have some specific tools for their data management.
And in this way we want to contribute in this community and give some more information about the good practices that we have at CERN.
So here you see the whole idea, 2020 community an so currently this project is in the last year an now we are actually brainstorming for new ideas for a follow up, probably if it is accepted.
And so I welcome you to give some ideas if you think that we could do something more an integrate more projects about the in the web semantics.
Community or what we could get about in this community.
Thank you for your attention.
